snippet: President Obama’s continued resistance to the word stood in contrast to Pope Francis, who recently called the massacres “the first genocide of the 20th century” and equated it to mass killings by the Nazis and Soviets.
abstract: Pres Obama acknowledges Armenian genocide on its 100th anniversary, but refuses to use word genocide; has avoided using word out of concern about angering Turkey, NATO ally that has long rejected description.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s continued resistance to the word stood in contrast to Pope Francis, who recently called the massacres “the first genocide of the 20th century” and equated it to mass killings by the Nazis and Soviets.

headline.main: White House Acknowledges Armenian Genocide, but Avoids the Term
headline.print_headline: White House Acknowledges Armenian Genocide, but Avoids the Term

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
